header.title: User's Guide DTDs

section.title: The part DTD
section.p: The part DTD is intended for a "normal" document, like the User's Guide or Release Notes. First are some paragraphs introducing the main contents. After that follows chapters, written in separate files with the chapter DTD.
section.pre:
The chapter title The author

Some text..

section.title: <part>
section.p: The top level tag of a part DTD.
Contains a <header>, an optional <description>, followed by one or more <include>.

section.title: <description>
section.p: The introduction after the title and before the bulk of included chapters/manual pages.
Contains any combination and any number of block tags except <image> and <table>.

section.title: <include>
section.p: An empty tag. The attribute file specifies a file to include. The .xml file extension should be omitted.

section.title: The chapter DTD
section.p: The chapter DTD is intended for a chapter in a User's Guide or similar with text divided into sections, which can be nested.
section.pre:
Title on first level

Introduction...

Title on second level

First paragraph.

Second paragraph etc.

Title on third level

...

...

section.title: <chapter>
section.p: The top level tag of a chapter DTD.
Contains a <header>, an optional introduction consisting of any combination of block tags, followed by one or more <section>.

section.title: <section>
section.p: Contains an optional <marker>, a <title>, followed by any combination and any number of block tags and <section>.
